actor_awards.notes: Won the Cecil B. DeMille Award in 1979. Received the Kennedy Center Honors in 1986. Legend of television comedy, best known for 'I Love Lucy'.

filmography.title: Stage Door
filmography.role_description: A cynical and wisecracking aspiring actress living in a boarding house with other theatrical hopefuls.
filmography.plot: A boardinghouse for aspiring actresses houses a mix of personalities, all hoping for their big break on Broadway.

filmography.title: The Big Street
filmography.role_description: A cruel, self-absorbed nightclub singer who becomes paralyzed and is cared for by a busboy who loves her.
filmography.plot: A humble busboy devotes his life to a selfish, invalid nightclub singer who treats him with contempt.

filmography.title: The Long, Long Trailer
filmography.role_description: A newlywed who convinces her husband to buy a massive trailer home for their honeymoon trip across the country.
filmography.plot: A newlywed couple buys a large travel trailer to live in as they travel across the United States for their honeymoon, leading to disastrous comedic situations.

filmography.title: Yours, Mine and Ours
filmography.role_description: A widow with eight children who falls in love with a widower with ten children.
filmography.plot: A widower with ten children marries a widow with eight, and the twenty of them try to come together as one family.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Dance, Girl, Dance
filmography.role_description: A brassy burlesque dancer who clashes with an aspiring ballerina over a man and their careers.
filmography.plot: A ballet dancer and a burlesque queen compete for the same man while struggling to achieve their dreams.

filmography.title: Five Came Back
filmography.role_description: A woman with a dark past who is one of the passengers stranded in the jungle after a plane crash.
filmography.plot: Twelve people survive a plane crash in the Amazon jungle, but only five can escape.

filmography.title: Lured
filmography.role_description: An American taxi dancer in London who goes undercover for Scotland Yard to catch a serial killer.
filmography.plot: A taxi dancer disappears in London, and her friend works with the police to entrap the serial killer responsible.

filmography.title: The Dark Corner
filmography.role_description: A loyal and resourceful secretary who helps her private investigator boss when he is framed for murder.
filmography.plot: A private eye is framed for murder and tries to clear his name with the help of his faithful secretary.

filmography.title: The Facts of Life
filmography.role_description: A married woman who engages in an affair with a long-time friend, played by Bob Hope.
filmography.plot: Two middle-aged people, married to others, find themselves falling in love during a vacation.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Mame
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, fun-loving aunt who raises her young nephew with a philosophy of 'Live! Live! Live!'
filmography.plot: The adventures of an eccentric aunt and her nephew.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actress in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy

filmography.title: Easy to Wed
filmography.role_description: A showgirl involved in a scheme to stop a libel suit, a role originally played by Jean Harlow in 'Libeled Lady'.
filmography.plot: A newspaper hires a gigolo to compromise a woman who is suing them for libel.

filmography.title: Fancy Pants
filmography.role_description: A nouveau-riche American who brings a British butler (Bob Hope) to her western hometown.
filmography.plot: An American actor posing as a British butler is hired to refine a rough-and-tumble family in the Wild West.

filmography.title: Sorrowful Jones
filmography.role_description: A nightclub singer who helps a bookie take care of an abandoned child.
filmography.plot: A New York bookie ends up with a young girl as collateral for a bet and has to learn to care for her.

filmography.title: Du Barry Was a Lady
filmography.role_description: A nightclub star who is pursued by a hat check boy who dreams he is King Louis XV.
filmography.plot: A coatroom attendant in love with a nightclub singer mistakenly drinks a drugged beverage and dreams he is King Louis XV of France.

filmography.title: Room Service
filmography.role_description: An assistant and love interest who helps the Marx Brothers avoid eviction.
filmography.plot: A producer tries to keep his cast and crew in a hotel room before they are evicted for not paying the bill.

filmography.title: Too Many Girls
filmography.role_description: A wealthy heiress who goes to college protected by four football players. Ball met Desi Arnaz on this set.
filmography.plot: A rich girl wants to go to college without bodyguards, so her father hires four football players to protect her secretly.

filmography.title: Critic's Choice
filmography.role_description: The wife of a theater critic who writes a play herself, causing domestic tension.
filmography.plot: A theater critic's wife writes a play, and he must decide whether to review it honestly or save his marriage.

filmography.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
filmography.role_description: A clumsy cosmetics saleswoman who gets mixed up in a murder investigation.
filmography.plot: A door-to-door cosmetics salesgirl becomes the prime suspect in a murder case.

filmography.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
filmography.role_description: A wacky secretary who tries to reform her bookie boss.
filmography.plot: A scatterbrained secretary is hired as a front for a bookie operation but ends up getting involved in housing projects.

filmography.title: Forever, Darling
filmography.role_description: A wife whose marriage is failing until her guardian angel (James Mason) intervenes.
filmography.plot: A scientist's wife goes on a field trip with him to save their marriage, aided by her guardian angel.

filmography.title: Best Foot Forward
filmography.role_description: She plays herself, a movie star who accepts an invitation to a military school prom as a publicity stunt.
filmography.plot: A movie star accepts a cadet's invitation to a dance at a military academy, causing chaos.

filmography.title: Stone Pillow
filmography.role_description: An elderly homeless woman who befriends a young social worker in this dramatic departure from her comedy roles. (TV Movie)
filmography.plot: A young social worker tries to connect with a bag lady to understand the plight of the homeless.

filmography.title: Follow the Fleet
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as a friend of Ginger Rogers' character in this Astaire-Rogers musical.
filmography.plot: Sailors on shore leave in San Francisco look for romance and try to save a dance hall.

filmography.title: Look Who's Laughing
filmography.role_description: A woman caught in a scheme involving Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy.
filmography.plot: Radio star Edgar Bergen takes a vacation and ends up involved in local politics and a romance.

filmography.title: Roman Scandals
filmography.role_description: One of her earliest appearances as a Goldwyn Girl, notable for her blonde look before becoming a redhead.
filmography.plot: A man dreams he is back in ancient Rome, where he gets involved in court intrigue.
